holidays.name: Penguin Awareness Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to appreciating the adorable and upright-walking penguins and raising awareness about their conservation.
holidays.origin: Started by wildlife enthusiasts to draw attention to penguin habitats and environmental threats.
holidays.funFact: Penguins propose to their mates with pebbles, making them one of nature's most romantic birds!

holidays.name: National Cheese Lover's Day
holidays.description: A celebration for everyone who can't resist the allure of gooey, melty, or sharp cheese varieties.
holidays.origin: Originated from food bloggers and cheese artisans wanting a day to honor fun cheese recipes.
holidays.funFact: The world's stinkiest cheese, Époisses, is so pungent it’s banned on French public transport!

holidays.name: National Disc Jockey Day
holidays.description: A tribute to DJs who spin tunes, mix tracks, and keep the party alive worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established to honor the creative DJs who influence music and party culture.
holidays.funFact: The first DJ is believed to be Ray Newby in 1909, who played records on a makeshift turntable setup.

holidays.name: National Substitute Teacher Day
holidays.description: A day to appreciate the substitute teachers who keep classrooms running smoothly when regular teachers are away.
holidays.origin: Created to acknowledge the vital role of substitute educators.
holidays.funFact: Some substitute teachers have gone on to become famous educators or even authors and speakers.

holidays.name: Inauguration Day (US) – varies but often January 20
holidays.description: Marks the swearing-in and peaceful transfer of the U.S. presidential administration every four years.
holidays.origin: Constitutional mandate for the U.S. President's oath of office after elections.
holidays.funFact: The tradition of a peaceful transition of power is a foundational aspect of American democracy and attracts worldwide attention.
